Zara Phillips and Mike Tindall have had a tough few months, having suffered a devastating miscarriage less than a month after they announced Zara was pregnant with their second child. 
But the couple were all smiles as they made their first public appearance since the tragic news broke, greeting acquaintances and posing for photographs together at the Pacific Fair Magic Millions Polo in Queensland, Australia. 
Zara, 35, even changed from her white lace shirt dress into some riding jodhpurs, a polo top and boots, so she could have a go at the sport herself. Zara Phillips with husband Mike Tindall at the Pacific Fair Magic Millions Polo in Queensland, Australia (Photo: Splash News) 
Unfortunately, the Queen's granddaughter took a tumble off her horse, but luckily didn't seem to be hurt. 
Her husband of five years didn't seem unduly concerned about her fall, telling the crowd: "That's her will to win. She's tough, she bounces." 
There was no sign of their little nearly-three-year-old daughter Mia, who was presumably being cared for by a nanny. The pair laughed and smiled as they greeted guests and friends (Photo: Splash News) Zara laughs as she chats with Australian entrepreneur Gerry Harvey (Photo: Splash News) 
Speaking ahead of the event, the royal's spokesperson told media that Olympic silver medallist Zara was "keen and ready to play" a game of polo. 
It comes just two weeks after the couple released the news of the loss of their second child. 
In a statement on Christmas Eve, their rep said: "Very sadly, Zara and Mike Tindall have lost their baby. At this difficult time, we ask that everyone respects their privacy." Like us on Facebook
